intro: Loeseneriella apocynoides var. apocynoides, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It produces small, berry-like fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it resilient to drought conditions.
